page.title: 14NEWTONMORE CAMANACHD 2
page.content: cont./ The goals are twelve feet wide and ten feet high and the pitch is about 160 yards by 80 yards. In Newtonmore the traditional place of play is{The Eilan,}situated beneath the commanding hill of Craig Dhu, and is close to the confluence of the Spey and the Calder south of the village. {Newtonmore Camanachd Club}was formally constituted about a hundred years ago. The club first won the Camanachd Cup, the trophy for the championship of Scotland, in 1907 and they have since repeated that feat on another 26 occasions, their nearest rivals, Kyles Athletic and Kingussie, on 19 and 8 occasions respectively. The club has an equally illustious record in the other major honours of thr game. Newtonmore Primary School is the vital nursery for what is the obsessive interest of the local community.
